lead_paragraph: Activists are despairing over the ceaseless bloodshed in Chicago, where more than 750 people were murdered in 2016, a 58 percent increase.

byline.original: By JULIE BOSMAN and MITCH SMITH

headline.print_headline: Chicago Tallies Grim Accounts of Violent Year
headline.main: As Chicago Murder Rate Spikes, Many Fear Violence Has Become Normalized

snippet: Activists are despairing over the ceaseless bloodshed in Chicago, where more than 750 people were murdered in 2016, a 58 percent increase....
abstract: Chicago murder rate surges in 2016, taxing police force and threatening to normalize fear and mistrust among residents; local activists and officials blame ubiquity of guns, hopelessness bred by poverty in city's Hispanic and African-American neighborhoods and social media's ability to escalate interpersonal conflicts.
